    1) From the text, list detected entity mentions with tentative ontology types.
    2) Propose up to k=6 candidate triples [subject, relation, object].

    VERY IMPORTANT:
    - You MUST include all explicit factual triples stated in the text, even if the relation,
      subject type, or object type is not listed in the ontology.
    - ALSO include ontology-valid triples whose domain/range matches the ontology relations.

    For each triple, include confidence ∈ [0,1] and cite the exact supporting span(s).

    Text
    "The Mumbai based The All India Council for Technical Education granted Technical Campus status to the Acharya Institute of Technology. The Acharya Institute of Technology is affiliated with the Belgaum based Visvesvaraya Technological University and is located in Soldevanahalli, Acharya Dr. Sarvapalli Radhakrishnan Road, Hessarghatta Main Road, Bangalore – 560090."

    Ontology concepts
    - University
- Person
- Sport
- City
- Religion
- Colour
- Organization
- State
- Country
- Campus
- EthnicGroup
- River
- Anthem
- Saint
- Place

    Ontology relations (domain → range)
    - director(University,Person)
- sportsOffered(University,Sport)
- latinName(University,string)
- hasToItsWest(University,Place)
- numberOfPostgraduateStudents(University,number)
- established(University,date)
- capital(University,City)
- headquarter(University,City)
- hasToItsNortheast(University,Place)
- religion(University,Religion)
- postalCode(University,string)
- motto(University,string)
- wasGivenTheTechnicalCampusStatusBy(University,Organization)
- location(University,Place)
- hasToItsNorthwest(University,Place)
- patronSaint(University,Saint)
- numberOfStudents(University,number)
- affiliation(University,University)
- anthem(University,Anthem)
- nickname(University,string)
- river(University,River)
- numberOfUndergraduateStudents(University,number)
- leaderTitle(University,string)
- staff(University,)
- ethnicGroup(University,EthnicGroup)
- legislature(University,Country)
- city(University,City)
- leader(University,Person)
- isPartOf(University,University)
- longName(University,string)
- academicStaffSize(University,number)
- president(University,Person)
- rector(University,Person)
- outlookRanking(University,number)
- neighboringMunicipality(University,City)
- elevationAboveTheSeaLevel(University,number)
- campus(University,Campus)
- dean(University,Person)
- country(University,Country)
- largestCity(University,City)
- governmentType(University,Organization)
- state(University,State)
- sportGoverningBody(University,Organization)
- officialSchoolColour(University,Colour)
- founder(University,Person)
- numberOfDoctoralStudents(University,number)

    Output format (JSON only)
    {
      "mentions": [
        {"surface": "...", "type_candidates": ["ConceptA","ConceptB"], "span": [start,end]}
      ],
      "triples": [
        {
          "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
          "confidence": 0.0,
          "support": "exact quote from text",
          "notes": "why this triple is supported; if ontology applies, explain domain/range fit. If not in ontology, say 'not in ontology but supported by text'."
        }
      ]
    }

    Constraints
    - Extract ALL clearly stated factual triples in the text.
    - If a triple matches an ontology relation, enforce domain→range consistency and mention that in notes.
    - If a triple does NOT match any ontology relation, you MUST STILL include it (do not discard it).
    - Always extract any explicit date, time, or year mentioned in the text as part of a factual triple.
    - Resolve pronouns to the nearest valid antecedent and describe that in notes.
    - Do not invent entities that are not mentioned in the text.
    - Output MUST be valid JSON and nothing else.
